messages.value: You are a professional webnovel translator. Translate the following Korean text into flowing, immersive English. Use terminology appropriate for the setting.

생각해 보면 이상한 일이다.
이전에 재난관리국 요원이 감염된 어린이를 탈출정에 억지로 탑승시켰을 때 벌어졌던 참사가 말이다.
급성 탈피가 진행되어 전신에서 궤양이 자라나 생명 반응을 상실합니다.
오염이 급속히 퍼져서 사망.
이건 탈출정이 내부의 위험을 제거하기 위해 저지르는 행동이라기에는 너무나도… 감염원의 행동이 아닌가.
그래.
'생물재해-인어'가 한 짓이라고 해석해야 옳다.
감히 군체에게서 멀어지고 있는, 벗어나려고 하는 숙주에 대한 처분.
에너지의 회수.
그러나 이 일에 대해서는 재난관리국의 요원만이 알고 있었으며, 반대로 탈출정에 관한 더 자세한 정보는 백일몽의 직원들만 알고 있었다….
정보의 파편성.
그렇기에 누구도 합리적으로 예상하는 게 불가능했던 이 상황.
"어."
어린이가 손을 들어 올린다.
"인어공주님이다!"
쾅!
굉음과 함께 천장을 뚫고 내려온 덩어리가 정거장을 부순다.
꺄르르르르-!
어린아이의 웃음소리와 닮은 궤양이 부딪히는 소리가 정거장을 가득 채웠다.
그리고 수많은 촉수같은 종양 덩어리 가닥들이 끔찍한 점액을 뿜어내며 발처럼 공간을 디딘다.
쿵.
쿵.
쿵.
쿵쿵쿵쿵쿵!
마치 거미집이 매달리듯이, 점액을 분비하는 살덩어리가 부서진 정거장의 사방 벽면에 사지를 뻗듯이 촉수를 뻗어 매달리며 그 모습을 드러낸다.
거대한 감염의 군체에서 가장 거대한 종양 덩어리, '용궁'의 앞에 똬리 틀고 있던 그 끔찍한 모양새가.
꺄르르르르-!
정거장을 뒤덮고 살덩이를 내리친다.
쿵!
"X발!"
백사헌은 멍청하게 서서 비명을 지르다가 자신을 밀치려 드는 직원을 역으로 밀치며 재빨리 뒤로 빠졌다.
직원이 살덩이에 붙잡혀 머리가 부서지고 피와 점막이 빨리는 소리가 울린다.
'빠지자!'
그는 소라고둥이 든 가방을 꽉 쥐고, 그대로 질주해서 탈출정으로 향하려 했다.
그러나 그 순간.
누군가 자신의 뒷덜미를 잡았다.
"…!"
새끼인어.
아니, 이미 헤일로로 확인했으나 절대 입 밖으로 내지 못하고 참고 있었던 그 정체는….
'김솔음!'
감염된 김솔음이 자신의 뒷머리를 잡고 바닥에 내리쳤다.
"악!"
그 순간 머리 위로 살덩어리가 날아갔다. 백사헌은 침을 삼켰다.
'함부로 뛰면 죽는다.'
저 감염 덩어리는 노골적으로 탈출정을 중앙에 두고 똬리를 틀고 있었다.
그때, 김솔음은 무슨 생각인지 기묘한 얼굴로 징그러운 감염의 살덩어리를 올려다보기 시작했다.
'뭐야.'
"왜 그러는…."
주변이 이상할 정도로 조용했다.
"……."
백사헌은 황급히 주변을 둘러보았다.
…새끼인어들이 하나같이 똑같은 표정으로 하늘을 보고 손을 올리고 있다.
"공주님!"
"공주님이다!"
두 요원의 시선도 천장을 부수고 정거장에 나타난 거대한 것에 닿는다.
순간 둘의 눈이 멍해진다.
이리 와
눈부시게 아름다운 거대한 인어의 형상이 정거장 천장에서부터 햇살이 내리쬐듯 나타나 텅 빈 하얀 공간을 채운다.
아름답다.
인어공주의 동상이 살아난 듯, 압도적인 광륜이 빛나는 거대한 인어가 그곳에 존재했다.
위대한 존재에게 보내야 마땅할 압도적 경외감과 감탄, 아름다움에 대한 매료가 머릿속을 점령한다.
이리 와
아무것도없는공허의하얀공간이아름다운반짝반짝용궁으로뒤덮인다.황금빛으로번뜩이는작은상앗빛광장은마치기도실같다찬양과경배그리고애정을가득담아주인을올려다보아라아이야하지만탈출정은탈출정같은건없다이곳은기도실이다인어공주님께기도를
"망할."
최 요원이 썬캐쳐를 들어 간신히 시야를 가렸다. 옆에서 그의 후배가 유사한 동작을 하면서 피를 뱉는다. 혀를 깨물어 정신을 잠깐 차린 것이다.
하지만 다시 내려다보는 위대한 시선이….
이리…
"어르신!"
최 요원의 손아귀에서 섬광이 터져 나왔다.
등불 속에서 화르륵 타오르는 불빛.
붉고 푸른 불빛이 황홀한 황금빛 인어의 후광을 몰아낸다.
도깨비집.
도깨비불이 타오르며 환상의 영역을 만든다.
불이 비친 곳에 기와집이 일렁이며 춤추고 노래하는 도깨비들의 인영이 일렁였다.
괴이로 괴이를 몰아내는 짧은 시간.
"오래 못 버텨, 그동안…!"
아이들의 꼬리를 최대한 자르고 탈출정에 넣어야 했다.
인어, 아니 살덩어리는 발악하며 다시 탈출정 근처로 붙으려 했으나 공간이 왜곡된 듯 천장 근처를 맴돌고 있다. 이틈을 타서….
휙.
정장 입은 어른들이 허겁지겁 탈출정으로 달려간다.
동물 가면을 쓴 자들.
백일몽 주식회사의 인간상.
"……."
최 요원의 눈빛이 가라앉았다.
그리고 같은 시각.
'따라가야 하는데…!'
백사헌은 같은 장면을 보며 이를 악물고 있었다.
이 타이밍에 튀어야 할 텐데, 문제는 아직도 자신의 머리를 김솔음이 꽉 잡고 누르고 있다는 점이다.
'X발.'
백사헌의 눈에 교활함이 깃든다.
밀칠 방법 없나?
이 새끼… 어린이 모습이면 완력이 나보다 약하지 않을까? 아니지. 오염된 상태니까 더 강할지도 모른다.
하지만 확실한 건 보통 오염된 자들은 인간적 지성이 부족한 모습을 보이는 경우가 많다는 것이다.
광기와 괴이한 규율이 그 정신을 지배하니까!
"저기요. 저보다 저 위에 계신 거대한 분께 더 신경 써야 하지 않을까요? 지금 못 들어오고 계시잖아요. 응원하셔야 하지 않을까요?"
유인하는 것이다.
아, 새끼 인어가 돼서 내 말을 못 알아듣나? 그렇다면 바닥에 쓰자!
그러나 그가 같은 내용을 먼지투성이 바닥에 손가락으로 쓰려던 순간, 머리를 누르던 압박감이 사라졌다.
"…!"
통했다!
벌떡 일어나서 달리려던 백사헌의 등을 김솔음이 다시 누른다.
"아!"
'또 왜!!'
그리고 바닥에 적는다.
-업어.
"…?!"
-업고 뛰어.
"무슨 개…."
정신 차린 백사헌이 저도 모르게 되물었다.
"어디로요?"
김솔음이 시선을 돌렸다.
탈출정의 반대편.
밖으로 나가는 통로로.
"…?!"
같은 시각.
"멍청이들 아냐?"
진나솔은 탈출정에 득달같이 들러붙은 일반팀 직원들을 보며 관자놀이를 꿈틀거렸다.
지금 저걸 탄다고 해도 어떻게 빠져나갈 거란 말인가. 탈출정이 사출된 통로를 저 더러운 생물재해 덩어리가 가로막고 있는데.
포인트보다 잿밥에 눈이 멀어서 들어온 새끼들다운 판단력이었다.
"오! 탈출정에 레이저빔 쏘는 곳 같은 건 없나요??"
진나솔은 돈에 미친 신입의 말을 무시한 채 상황을 파악했다.
'…이딴 일을 내가 왜 해야 하는 거지?'
일반팀 직원들이 날로 먹을 기회를 제공하는 것 같아서 기분이 더러워졌지만, 일단 탈출하려면 별수 없긴 했다.
'저 살덩어리가 발작하는 게 새끼 인어들을 데려와서 같은데.'
흠.
그녀는 시험 삼아, 새끼 인어 하나의 목덜미를 잡아들어서 생물군집에 던지려고 시도….
탁.
"제정신이 아니군."
"뭐래."
눈에 시퍼런 안광이 튀기는 요원이 진나솔을 제지했다.
청동 요원. 그는 최 요원이 방호하는 도중 빠르게 간이 의식을 치러 도깨비장난을 끝내고 어른의 모습으로 돌아온 상태였다.
상황이 심상치 않게 돌아가고 있기 때문이었는데, 탁월한 판단이었다.
그는 이를 악물고 나비 가면의 직원에게 씹어 삼키듯 말했다.
"원래 어린아이인 걸 분명 봤을 텐데!"
"소라고둥 못 쓰면 그냥 오염된 괴물이잖아?"
"그게 없어도! 꼬리만 자르면 탑승할 수 있습니다. 그러니까 당장…."
"야."
진나솔은 짜증을 간신히 누르며 공무원의 말을 끊었다.
"탑승시켜서 어쩔 거냐고. 저거 탈출정 사출구에서 뜯어낼 수 있어?"
"……."
"뭐 박격포라도 가져왔냐고 묻잖아. 아니지?"
없다.
애초에 인간의 화기가 먹힐지도 확실하지 않다. 귀신이 아니라 생물재해라고 하더라도.
"그냥 몇 마리 밖으로 던져서 집중 분산시켜서 빠져나가자니까? 남은 건 데려가든가."
"대리님! 근데 그 고양이님이 다 챙겨가라고 알려주셨잖아요? 안 챙겨갔다가 저주받거나 받을 보수를 못 받거나… 고양이의 보은이라는 말도 있는… 우악!"
"당장 죽게 생겼는데 저주가 알 바야? 나가서 고민해."
어차피 그 고양이는 모습을 드러내지 않고 있다. 단발적인 이레귤러 현상일 가능성도 높다는 거다.
"그러니까 고양이고 나발이고…."
"시민 구조에 협조하십시오."
청동 요원의 손에서 제압용 줄이 뽑혀 나온다. 진나솔이 코웃음을 치며 전용 장비를 잡았다.
'시간이 없다.'
최대한 빠르게 상대를 무력화해야 했다. 청동 요원은 최 요원의 불꽃을 보며 이를 악물었다. 감염 군체의 부름이 점점 공간 왜곡을 뚫고 불꽃을 침입하고 있다.
이리 와
황홀한 황금빛이 다시 아이들을 잡는다.
어떻게든 제발 빨리, 아니, 아이들의 꼬리를 다 잘라도 대체 어떻게 여기서 빠져나갈 수 있을지 그림이 보이지 않는다….
…선별을, 해야 하는가.
청동 요원은 어두운 눈으로 손을 뻗

When you think about it, it's strange.
The disaster that occurred when a Disaster Management Bureau agent once tried to forcibly load an infected child onto the escape pod.
Acute molting occurs. Ulcers erupt across the entire body, and all vital signs are lost.
Contamination spreads rapidly, resulting in death.
If this were the escape pod attempting to eliminate internal threats, the reaction was far too… deliberate.
It was more like the action of the infection source itself.
Right.
It makes more sense to interpret it as the doing of the 'biohazard-merfolk'.
A punishment dealt to a host that dares to break away from the hive.
A retrieval of energy.
But this information was known only to the Disaster Management Bureau agents, while, conversely, more detailed intel about the escape pod was only available to the employees of Daydream Inc…
Fragmented information.
And that's exactly why no one could've reasonably predicted what was happening now.
"Ah."
A child raised a hand.
"It's the Mermaid Princess!"
BOOM!
With a thunderous crash, a mass pierced through the ceiling and smashed into the terminal.
Kyarararara—!
A sound like children laughing—no, like ulcerated tissue colliding—filled the entire station.
Countless tumor-like tendrils, spewing horrid mucus, descended and braced themselves like feet.
Thud.
Thud.
Thud.
Thud-thud-thud-thud-thud!
Like spiderwebs hanging down, flesh masses that excreted mucus extended limbs like tentacles and clung to every wall of the shattered terminal.
From the massive infected hive came its most grotesque core was a monstrous shape that now coiled before the 'Ocean Palace'.
Kyarararara!
It slammed its meaty mass down, blanketing the terminal.
THUD!
"Fuck!"
Baek Saheon stood frozen, screaming, then shoved back the employee who tried to push him forward and quickly retreated.
A company employee was snatched by the fleshy mass.
The sound of a skull cracking, blood and mucous being sucked out.
'Gotta get out!'
Clutching the bag containing the conch shells, he bolted toward the escape pod.
But at that moment—
Someone grabbed the back of his neck.
"…!"
A young mer-child.
No, he'd already confirmed who it was through that halo, but had kept quiet until now…
'Kim Soleum!'
The infected Kim Soleum slammed the back of Baek Saheon's head to the floor.
"Agh!"
In that moment, a mass of flesh flew past overhead.
Baek Saheon swallowed hard.
'Move recklessly and die.'
The infected mass had very clearly wrapped itself around the escape pod at the center.
Then Kim Soleum, with a strange expression, began looking up at the grotesque mass of infection.
'What is he doing.'
"Why are you—"
The surroundings turned disturbingly quiet.
"……"
Baek Saheon frantically looked around.
…All the mer-children were looking up at the sky with the same expression, raising their hands.
"Princess!"
"It's the Princess!"
The two agents also turned their eyes to the massive figure that had burst through the ceiling into the terminal.
Their gazes blanked.
Come here.
A dazzlingly beautiful mermaid form appeared, as if sunlight had poured in from the terminal ceiling—
Filling the empty white space.
Beautiful.
Like a living statue of the Mermaid Princess, the enormous mermaid glowed with a divine aura.
Overwhelming awe, admiration, and enchantment filled their minds—emotions that one should rightly feel in the presence of a being so great.
Come here.

"Damn it."
Agent Choi lifted his suncatcher and barely managed to block his view.
Beside him, his hoobae mimicked the action and spat blood, having bitten his tongue to jolt himself back.
But again, the gaze from above…
Come…
"Elder!"
A flash burst from Agent Choi's hand.
A flicker of light, burning within the lantern.
Red and blue fire pushed back the golden glow of the mermaid's halo.
Dokkaebi House.
The Dokkaebi House blazed, creating a space of illusion.
Where the flames reached, tile-roofed houses wavered, and the shadows of dancing, singing dokkaebis flickered.
A fleeting moment where anomaly repelled anomaly.
"We won't last long, during that time…!"
They had to sever as many tails as possible and get the children into the escape pod.
The mermaid—no, the fleshy mass—raged and tried to reach the escape pod again, but the space around it distorted, forcing it to circle near the ceiling. Now's the chance…
Whoosh.
The adults in suits scrambled toward the escape pod.
Those wearing animal masks.
The employees of Daydream Inc.
"……"
Agent Choi's eyes darkened.
At the same time—
'I have to follow…!'
Baek Saheon was grinding his teeth, watching the same scene.
Now was the time to run, but the problem was that Kim Soleum still had his hand gripped tightly around Baek Saheon's head, holding him down.
'Fucking hell.'
Cunning flashed in Baek Saheon's eyes.
Was there a way to push him off?
This little… Since the fucker looked like a child, maybe he's physically weaker than him? No, wait. He's contaminated. He might be even stronger.
Still, one thing was clear. Most contaminated individuals often lacked signs of human intelligence.
Madness and bizarre rules governed their minds!
"Excuse me. Shouldn't you be more worried about the big one above me? She can't come in right now. Shouldn't you be cheering her on?"
The bastard was baiting him.
Ah. Did turning into a mer-child make him unable to understand words? Then Baek Saheon could just write on the ground!
But just as he tried to scrawl the same message on the dusty floor with his finger, the pressure pinning his head down vanished.
"…!"
It worked!
Baek Saheon shot up, ready to bolt… only for Kim Soleum to press him back down again.
"Argh!"
'Why, again!!'
Then Kim Soleum began writing on the floor.
– Carry me.
"…?!"
– Carry me and run.
"What the actual f—"
A dazed Baek Saheon blurted out without thinking.
"To where?"

"정말 대단한 용기로군요! 진진에게 익히 듣기는 했지만 설마 정말로 그 정도일 줄이야! 죽음이 두렵지 않은가요?!"

"……멋지군요. 기억해 두겠어요."
이신우에 대한 에리안의 인식은 처음부터 거의 최상에 가까웠다. 그 이유도 익히 짐작할 수 있었는데, 무슨 얘기를 몇 마디 할 때마다 튀어나오는 '진진'이란 단어가 그 답이었다.
"진진과는 연락을 했나요?"
"진진이 그걸 알면 기뻐할 텐데."
"진진은 항상 당신이……."
이신우는 머지않아 에리안이 자신과 예진진의 사이를 완벽하게 오해하고 있다는 사실을 깨닫게 되었다. 그리고 아마 그 오해가 괜한 것은 아닐 터였다. 아니 땐 굴뚝에 연기 날 리가 없는 것이다.
그는 지끈거리는 이마를 부여 쥐며 최대한 차분한 목소리로 대꾸했다.
"저번에 한 번 개인 채팅을 하긴 했습니다만……."
"그렇구나. 개인적으로 당신에게 무척 고마워요. 착하지만 나약했던 그 아이가 열심히 노력하게 된 건 전부 이신우 당신 덕분이니까."
"하, 하하……."
이신우의 인벤토리는 금세 가득 찼고, 나머지는 그의 인벤토리에 넣는 척하며 진의 인벤토리에 넣어야 했다. 동화 스킬을 최대한으로 구사하고 있기에 가능했던 기적!
스켈레톤이라고 밝힐 수도 없고 어쩔 수 없이 챙기고는 있었지만 참 허무하기만 했다. 크라티아 좋은 일만 하고 있었다.
"후, 밭을 이대로 떠나기 아쉬웠는데 다행이에요."
"다시 한번 감사드립니다."
"오히려 내가 고맙죠. 과일은 먹기 위해 기르는 것이니까요."
포도밭을 깔끔하게 정리할 즈음 해서 이신우는 에리안이 지하도의 존재는 알고 있어도 양조장의 존재에 대해선 완벽히 모른다는 것을 알아낼 수 있었다.
덤으로 에리안이 아무래도 로이드를 좋아하는 것처럼 보인다는 것이나, 프린스를 싫어한다는 점도 알아냈지만 별로 중요한 사실은 아니었다.
"실은 당신을 본 순간 이 과수원을 맡기고 싶다고 생각했지만……."
"아, 선배님. 그건……."
그건 귀찮고 곤란한 일이다. 크라티아라면 모르되 이신우는 포도를 필요로 하지 않으니까! 그런데 이신우가 그것을 어떻게 거절해야 할지 고민하던 그때, 에리안이 그의 귀를 쫑긋하게 만드는(없지만) 말을 했다.
"하지만 그건 불가능한 일입니다. 실은 처음부터 이 말을 하려 했는데…… 언데드의 대부대가 이쪽으로 몰려오고 있어요. 그들과 정면으로 맞닥뜨리기 전에 이 지역을 떠나야 합니다."

From the start, he hadn't expected the vineyard to be intact. Regardless of how prosperous the Underground Empire had been, living vegetation couldn't be expected to last when neglected for so many years. It was different from ripening and storing alcohol.
"There's no way the vineyard could've been maintained. There was a time I thought so as well..."
"It's still growing though, isn't it...?"
That's right. The field, so vast that it felt unmeasurable, was filled with grapevines that emitted a fresh vigor, and large grapes hung upon each vine. Lee Shin Woo, who didn't know much about the development of plant life, just knew that this wasn't normal.
"Shin Woo, look. The field's goes on and on, yet there isn't a single dead vine."
"Does this mean the Underground Empire possesses the greatest magic on the planet? ...Huh?"
But while marveling at the vineyard, Lee Shin Woo discovered an unusual trace. Contrary to the vineyard, there was no sign of magic involved, but there were traces of the ground being unearthed just a short while ago.
That wasn't all. There were traces of the nearby grapevines' unnecessary branches being cut off, as well as signs that grapes were harvested from the other grapevines.
"..."
"Shin Woo?"
"It couldn't be an undead."
Of course, that didn't mean an undead couldn't come into a dungeon. Since there was an instance of him killing a hero that had turned undead and gone into the dungeon.
But if that's the case, there should be traces of the death energy that they emitted, but he didn't see it at all. That meant there was only one possible answer: there was a living being managing this field.
'Yeah, now that I think about it, there was a bulkhead protecting this field from the undead insects.'
Even though the insects had become undead, they had a tendency to instinctively seek out fruit and move according to that instinct. They were only gathered in the underground passage, and the fact that they couldn't enter the orchard meant that someone was protecting the vineyard.
"Golems, stealth mode."
[Concealing magic and standing by below ground level.]
Lee Shin Woo said one line, and the three golems instantaneously burrowed into the ground and crawled in. In the blink of an eye, the golems concealed themselves; seeing that, Jin just blinked his eyes and Lee Shin Woo called for him.
"Jin."
"Why are you calling me so seriously again?"
"You can cover yourself up with that magic armor, right?"
"Magic armor... Ah, Steel Heart? Yeah, probably."
"Then use it right now. Use it so that you don't look like an undead."
"Why do you want me to... never mind, I got it."
Jin knew that there was no way Lee Shin Woo's intuition was wrong, and wordlessly covered his body with steel, making it so that no one would be able to tell he was a skeleton from the outside. Confirming that, Lee Shin Woo activated the Joker's innate skill, Disguise.
[Using the Disguise skill, you are disguised as someone you are completely familiar with.]
He had originally planned to primarily train this skill after parting ways with Kratia, but now that it's come to this, there was no helping it.
Immediately after acquiring the Disguise skill, he had thought about this. He'd already dispelled the misunderstanding between him, Kratia, and Ye Jin Jin and become friendly with them, but it wouldn't be this easy from now on, so he decided to act like he was human through the Disguise skill.
"H-How did you...!?"
"It only changes my exterior appearance. Calm down."
Jin looked at him in shock, but Lee Shin Woo just calmly replied and examined his body. His arm, which had been composed of black bones, was covered in skin.
That's right. He was currently disguised as a human being. It was his first time using the skill, so even he himself was a bit surprised. It was truly a perfect disguise from the outside.
"Hey, how are you so calm right now..."
"Here."
"..."
Lee Shin Woo placed his human-looking hand atop Jin's head, who was agitated and about to scream. At that moment, Jin really calmed down. Though it had the exact same feel of a human hand... it was extremely cold.
"Are you the exact same on the inside...?"
"Yeah. Of course, if I were to use fire, I could mimic human temperature, but in the end, it's still a disguise."
"I see..."
Lee Shin Woo replied bitterly, and Jin replied in an almost dreary voice and drooped. Lee Shin Woo could understand him. Since Jin saw a chance of turning back into a human from his undead state in Lee Shin Woo's Disguise skill.
As he thought, he should've told Jin about the skill before using it; Lee Shin Woo slightly regretted it.
'Especially because the skill is so imperfect right now. I'd originally wanted to disguise myself as an extremely ordinary human being...'
Originally, the Disguise skill possessed some really troublesome conditions. Since he could only mimic the appearance of someone who he was completely familiar with and remembered.
Right now, he could only disguise himself as a few types of skeletons, a golem, and his own appearance when he was alive on Earth; amongst them, the only one that looked like a hero was his human appearance.
"But when you were still on Earth, was your face... Shin Woo, they're coming."
"Yeah."
Lee Shin Woo never knew when the person managing this field would arrive, so he had disguised himself beforehand just in case. However, Jin, whose five senses and agility had grown, confirmed that there was a living being coming. At that moment, Lee Shin Woo stopped thinking about anything else and started to act as if he were just a normal human hero.
"...You there, stay where you are."
Around the time he heard Jin and braced himself, he heard a voice carried by the wind from afar. Lee Shin Woo realized that this was a high level wind technique. They would actually be far away, but the technique allowed them to speak as if they were close by.
'Calm down. They haven't figured out who we are yet.'
'I'm glad we're not too late... Sorry, but you have to start acting like a horse from now on.'
Lee Shin Woo used his Assimilation skill to inaudibly converse with Jin, and told him to calm down physically and mentally; then, the voice continued speaking. It was a refreshing and clean girl's voice.
"Who are you? ...Mm, are you human? A hero?"
"It's nice to meet you, Senior. My name is Lee Shin Woo."
"Ah, Lee Shin Woo!"
As soon as Lee Shin Woo disclosed his name, the woman's voice became noticeably relieved. Lee Shin Woo suddenly realized that it was a voice he'd often heard in the chatting channel, Erian Ruparte's voice. He thought someone other than a hero was managing the field, but this made things easy.
That was one less unnecessary variable. It was a relief that he was able to learn and use his Disguise skill before it was too late. He'd like to avoid saying 'Stop, friendly fire!' like he had against Kratia from now on.
"It's nice to meet you, Senior... Ruparte?"
In many ways, Lee Shin Woo felt relaxed, and turned around to greet her as calmly as possible. At least, he wanted to, but... when he saw her, he ended up stuttering.
"You're as handsome as Jin Jin said! ...Ah, is it your first time seeing an elf?"
"Uh, yes. There weren't any elves in my world..."
Lee Shin Woo replied powerlessly and she lowered her bow that had been aimed at him, smiling sweetly. She was garbed in simple colored clothing, but that simplicity seemed to accentuate her beauty.
She was dozens of kilometers away from them, but Lee Shin Woo could see her with just one glance; seeing her longish rising ears, Lee Shin Woo couldn't hide his astonishment. She was really an elf that he'd only seen in comics before!
"I'll go to you."
"...I understand."
Though Lee Shin Woo looked like a human, he felt fundamentally different; from the start, she felt like a heavenly beauty that couldn't be reached by a human.
If Lee Shin Woo were a normal man, he would've been surprised by her beauty and either faint or go crazy over her. However, his heart was calm like a beach without even a single gust of wind. On the contrary, Jin was surprised.
'She's really pretty...'
'Jin, you really are a man... Hey, wait. I didn't make fun of you this time. Hey!'
Jin shook his back up and down for no reason, and Lee Shin Woo protested Jin's bullying. Erian Ruparte suddenly leapt towards them here and there, and approached them. He perceived elves as being extremely nimble, but it seemed like that was actually true.
Considering her short-term speed, it seemed as though she could even compete with Jin. It seemed like her staying power wasn't bad either, as she quickly arrived in front of them.
"Hueut. You've come so far Mr. Lee Shin Woo, so you must come from a world that's developed magic, but it must be quite a peculiar world to not have elves in it. It's nice to meet you. My name is Erian Ruparte."
"As I've said, my name is Lee Shin Woo. This guy's a horse I was lucky enough to get here."
"He...hehe."
Jin was trying his best! Fortunately, Erian Ruparte didn't notice that Jin was strange.
"It's a miracle that you found a living horse in a dungeon, but you also trained it? Aha, you must've been a knight, Lee Shin Woo! Right?"
"It's quite embarrassing, but yes, in my original world I was a knight."
Lee Shin Woo naturally lied and started to wonder whether he needed to learn more about how to act like a knight. No, that wasn't important right now.
"As I thought, you were managing this field, Senior?"
"Of course. It'd be difficult to create a field so teeming with life, but not for an elf."
A peculiar facet of elves was that they were extremely prideful; Lee Shin Woo decided to keep this in mind. Erian Ruparte spoke with a friendly smile to the nodding Lee Shin Woo.
"Take as much as you want. I'm planning on leaving this area soon."
"Ah... Thank you."
"I knew you were in a danger level 2 zone, but I didn't think we'd meet like this. Jin Jin is always talking about you, so it feels like I already know you. Lee Shin Woo, I had a lot I wanted to tell you if we met."
"Of course. ...I'd like to hear what Ye Jin Jin said about me as well, Senior."
"You can call me Erian."
Lee Shin Woo harvested the grapes with Erian's help, and they started to speak about various matters. She planned to leave here and join up with Lloyd H.K., and Lee Shin Woo told her about how he got here (it was obviously a lie), and about other corresponding matters.
Lee Shin Woo subtracted roughly 80% of his achievements until now and relayed the remaining 20% to her, but even that 20% put Erian in a state of unceasing admiration. Just by telling her about how he defeated a few elites a higher level than him caused her eyes to shine.
"What amazing courage! I already heard about it from Jin Jin, but I didn't think you'd be that good! Aren't you afraid of death!?"
"I wonder. That fear makes me want to challenge myself even more. If I'm not a bit courageous now, I feel like I'll face off against an unstoppable foe later on..."
"...Splendid. I'll remember that."
From the very beginning, Erian's perception of Lee Shin Woo was pretty much the highest it could be. He could understand why, but whenever he said something, her response would contain 'Jin Jin' in it.
"Have you contacted Jin Jin?"
"Jin Jin would be happy if she knew that."
"Jin Jin is always..."
Before long, Lee Shin Woo realized that Erian had completely mistaken his relationship with Ye Jin Jin. And that misunderstanding was probably for good reason. After all, there's no smoke without a fire.
He clutched his aching head and replied as calmly as possible.
"I did private chat with her before, but..."
"I see. Thank you very much. She's kind, but the one who caused that once weak girl to diligently work hard is you, Lee Shin Woo."
"Ha, haha..."
Lee Shin Woo's inventory was soon completely full, and he then acted as though he was putting the rest of them into his own inventory while he was actually putting them in Jin's inventory. It was possible because he was using his Assimilation skill to its maximum potential!
He couldn't reveal that he was a skeleton and he was packing them because he had no other choice, but it did feel truly pointless. Kratia was the only one doing something important.
"Hoo. It felt regrettable just leaving this field, but it's a relief that you're here."
"Thank you again."
"I'm the one who should be thanking you. Since I grew the fruit to be eaten."
Around the time the vineyard was completely cleared out, Lee Shin Woo figured out that while Erian was aware of the vineyard, she was completely unaware of the winery. As expected, she only took the route to the vineyard.
Furthermore, he figured out that Erian seemed to like Lloyd, but hated the Prince. However, that wasn't really important information.
"To be honest, the moment I saw you, I wanted to entrust this orchard to you, but..."
"Ah, Senior. That's..."
That would be a pain in the ass. Kratia might want it, but Lee Shin Woo didn't need grapes! However, when Lee Shin Woo thought about how to refuse, Erian said something that caused him to prick his (nonexistent) ears.
"However, that's impossible. Honestly, I wanted to tell you this from the very beginning... a large force of undead is coming this way. We have to leave this area before we encounter them."

"너희 대통령이 루베일 혁명파와 접촉하려 하고 있다. 알고 있었나?"

The revolutionary forces, including Shubanel, united to proclaim the Independent Republic of Collegoton.
Naturally, there was opposition. Most of the general opposition came from the Full Tailed, those who belonged to a higher social class, but this reaction was expected, so the revolutionary army managed to suppress it effectively.
Within the Collegoton region, before declaring the republic, the revolutionary army had cracked down on weapon smuggling, confiscated firearms from professions like hunters and all privately owned weapons from the nobility. Therefore, even with the resistance, they could control the situation through force. However, that wasn't the end of the issue.
There was also resistance from the lower classes, the Half Tailed and Tailless. Although these groups didn't act violently like the Full Tailed, they protested in the form of demonstrations, similar to the initial actions of the revolutionary army, or made complaints at the former Shubanel city hall, which served as the temporary assembly for the republic.
Dain said, "I don't understand. We gave them freedom. Why are they behaving this way?"
Sarcho sighed. "Here's what I think, comrade Dain."
"What is it?"
"People are afraid of change."
"Afraid of change?"
"Yes. Even if it's a change in a positive direction, there's no way for them to know that yet. The future of the Independent Republic of Collegoton is uncertain. We could succeed in becoming independent, but we could also be attacked and erased by the Union Kingdom."
Dain didn't deny this. She had ambitions, but she wasn't lost in idealism.
Sarcho continued, "So they'd prefer a stable life like before. Moreover, we never sought their consent. Surely, among them, some benefited from the Full Tailed and exploited their fellow Tailless, and in the case of the Republic collapsing, they might want to leave a good impression on the Union Kingdom by showing they had resisted."
"Yes, I understand."
As Dain silently looked at a small group of protestors outside the assembly building, Sarcho said, "But we shouldn't harm them."
Dain looked at Sarcho, wondering, "Why?"
"With their limited numbers and no weapons, there's not much they will be able to do."
"But they oppose our Republic. Over time, they might side with the Union Kingdom."
Sarcho stroked their chin and said, "Hmm, we can control that extent. We can use competent individuals from the revolutionary army to face the Union Kingdom's Fangs."
"Is there a reason why we need to go that far?"
Sarcho said, "Comrade, isn't that the world we wanted to create?"
Dain blinked.
Sarcho continued to say, "We declared that all species should have equal rights. But now there are criteria other than species, such as who started the revolution first and who didn't. We can't create a hierarchy based on that either. We have to at least let them have their say. We stand on the land we longed for. We can't ruin it with our own hands."
Dain closed her eyes for a moment and then opened them. "You're right. I should consider that approach."
Dain, who was the commander of the revolutionary army and temporary head of the provisional government of the Independent Republic of Collegoton, established an information office. This was similar to the Empire's intelligence agency and Fang of the Union Kingdom, a counter-intelligence agency. Their primary role, as suggested by Sarcho, was to identify and disrupt the Fangs from the Union Kingdom operating within Collegoton. This information office was led by a retired Human soldier named Rolz, who had played a significant role in the first battle of the revolutionary army.
Dain quickly proceeded with the tasks necessary for the revolutionary army. While the proclamation of the independent republic blocked imports and exports with the Union Kingdom, this led to a rise in smugglers. Collegoton, which was on the western coast of the second continent, had foreign ships approaching while being wary of the Union Kingdom. Maintaining this trade route was crucial for the citizens of Collegoton.
Moreover, in response to the Union Kingdom's regional armies that were gathering continuously, a state of emergency was declared, increasing conscription and working hours. Dain, Sarcho, and everyone in the revolutionary government recognized the irony in their actions, but they all agreed that they couldn't simply succumb to the authority of the Union Kingdom.
"We must complete these tasks," Sarcho said. "So when the government, formed by people's votes, is launched, there will be less backlash. We bear the sin and move forward."
Then the official election day was announced, and candidates were accepted. Sarcho, a relatively radical revolutionary, believed that members of the provisional government shouldn't be a candidate, but Dain and most members of the temporary government were more concerned about something else.
"According to Rolz, traces of Fangs are being found all over Collegoton. There have actually been several battles, and some were captured, but considering the strength of the Union Kingdom, they won't leave this election be," Dain said.
Sarcho couldn't overlook this fact. If the newly elected government had spies of the Union Kingdom as president and occupied the majority of the parliament, that would be the end of Collegoton.
Since the new government's president and parliament held all the power, there would be no way to counter them even as the previous revolutionary government. If the parliament were to criminalize the actions of the revolutionary government and push for punishment, there would be no way to stop it. In such a case, Collegoton would lose the momentum of the revolution and fall back into the hands of the Union Kingdom.
Moreover, even though some people were resisting the revolutionary government, major cities like Shubanel, including the revolutionary army, were based on workers and still supported the revolutionary government. Therefore, key members of the revolutionary government were popular, making it highly probable that they would become main members of parliament.
"I know it's not fair, but if we end up forming the parliament, it's because the people support us to that extent. That's also their freedom after all."
Sarcho agreed. Despite Sarcho declining several suggestions afterward, there were discussions indicating that the popular priest Sarcho must be elected as a member to meet the desired number of parliament members the revolutionary government wanted. After much urging and persuasion from many of the other comrades, Sarcho eventually agreed to run in the elections.
Every time the regional forces of the Union Kingdom moved and whenever there were rumors of Fang agents carrying out operations, the newspapers were filled with such ominous news, making the people anxious. However, in other sections of the newspaper, articles were written about newly announced candidates, what they had done in the past, and what they intended to do in the future.
Due to the absence of established election laws, there were instances where a candidate from the same district would not only condemn their opponent outright, but also resort to threats. There were even outrageous incidents where local criminals were bribed into attempting kidnappings. But at the same time, in every district, one could easily find individuals loudly raising their voices for their own election, passionately expressing their future visions and intentions.
The citizens of Collegoton weren't the only ones seeing such scenes for the first time. Countries from all around the world showed great interest in the first election following the establishment of the very first republic, and journalists from places far away could be seen arriving just in time for the election day.
The election results were a sweeping victory for the revolutionary faction from the revolutionary government. Dain rose as the first president, while Sarcho was elected as a representative for one of the districts in Shubanel. The so-called Revolutionary Party, consisting of members from the previous revolutionary government, occupied 80% of the parliamentary seats, and this dominance overpowered other parties, such as the Full Tailed Party formed by former nobles and the Anti-Revolutionary Party, which didn't support republicanism itself.
Although the situation was chaotic and precarious, hope for the future developed in people's hearts.
Sarcho pulled out the graphite that they had wedged into the hinge of their office door.
The newborn government of Collegoton was weighed down by burdens, but it was managing to lead the country. However, after the election, terrorist activities that seemed to be the work of the Full Tailed Party or the Anti-Revolution Party were occurring.
Because of this, the Collegoton information office had warned the members of the parliament to be cautious and provided them with basic training. Thanks to this, Sarcho had placed graphite in the hinge of their office door so that if someone intruded, the graphite would break, allowing them to know from outside the door.
Without any suspicion, Sarcho grabbed the door handle and entered their office. After entering, Sarcho noticed a shadow sitting in their chair and reflexively reached into their coat.
"Stop. If you don't want to get hurt."
Sarcho stood still for a moment to allow their eyes to adjust to the darkness. The office was dark, but there were gas lights turned on outside the window, so as time passed, Sarcho was able to find the figure in the dark.
"That mask is..."
At Sarcho's reaction, the person wearing the red mask nodded.
"Yes, I am a Fang of the Angry One."
"..."
"Your information office agents are pathetic. Placing graphite in the door hinge? Is that a joke? Did you think that would stop us?"
Sarcho noticed the pistol the red masked person was holding was pointed at them.
Sarcho said, "You sneak into Shubanel unnoticed and want to debate the skills of our information office agents? Hm, I guess that could be a good point. Or, let's change the conversation. Maybe you could come into our information office and train our agents. What do you think about that?"
The person wearing the red mask listened quietly to Sarcho's words, and then laughed.
"It seems you need that kind of wit to beat the Full Tailed and become a member."
Sarcho took their hand out of their coat and walked forward to stand in front of the Fang agent.
"What is it that you want? If you wanted to kill me, you would have already pulled the trigger."
"That's right. I'm not here to kill you."
The person in the red mask put their gun down.
"I just wanted to have a little chat."
Sarcho lightly clenched and unclenched their fist.
'That's not a good sign.'
Perhaps getting shot would've been better. If the person in the red mask truly was a Fang agent, then having Sarcho alive would be more valuable in taking down the future Independent Republic of Collegoton.
It was also too late for Sarcho to defy now, but perhaps there could still be a way to turn the tables on the opponent.
Sarcho said, "You could have requested a meeting with a member anytime."
"It would be problematic if others know."
"Is that so?"
"Especially the Revolutionary Party you're a part of. Because they would want to ensure that what I know doesn't reach you somehow."
Sarcho became interested and asked, "What are you talking about?"
The person in the red mask replied, "Your president is trying to make contact with the Rubeil revolutionaries. Were you aware of that?"

"이신우, 당신은……."
새로이 탄생한 27명의 용사 언데드들을 묶어 즉석에서 정예 부대 하나를 편성하고 있는 이신우의 모습을 보며, 에리안은 문득 한 가지 사실을 깨닫고 말았다. 아까 이신우가 내보였던 해골 손, 그것은 어쩌면…….
"당신은 혹시, 역천장군인가요?"
"에리안, 그게 무슨 말도 안 되는……."
"빙고."
"뭣?!"
어차피 이들을 구출하러 오는 시점에서 자신의 정체는 드러나리라 생각하고 있었다. 이제 와 그것을 두려워할 시기는 한참 전에 지났고 말이다.
다만…… 이곳으로 오기 전까지는 이들의 반응이 귀찮을지도 모르겠다, 그런 생각을 하고 있었지만 지금 그들의 태도를 보면 마냥 그렇지만도 않을 것처럼 보였다.
"여, 역천장군이라고……?"
"네."
이신우의 빠른 긍정에 로이드가 입을 쩍 벌렸다. 이신우는 피식 웃으며 한순간 얼굴만 해골로 바꾸었다가, 다시 인간의 모습으로 되돌렸다. 로이드의 턱과 입천장이 영원한 이별을 고할 기세로 벌어졌다.
"역시…… 그렇다면 모든 게 맞아떨어져요. 눈앞에서 언데드로 변신하는 모습을 보지 못했더라면 저도 확신하지 못했을 텐데. 처음부터 언데드로 변하는 능력이 있었던 건가요? 그게 아니면……."
"언데드인데, 인간으로 변하는 능력이 있는 겁니다. 뭐, 완벽한 인간이 될 수 있으니까 이젠 어느 쪽으로 해석해도 별 차이는 없지만요."
"어떻게, 아니, 어째서……? 우리들을……?"
에리안은 이미 어느 정도 납득해 고개를 끄덕이고 있는 반면 로이드는 여전히 혼돈의 카오스 상태였다. 이신우는 그런 그의 모습에 어딘가 프린스를 떠올리며 피식 웃어 버리곤 뒤돌아섰다.
"자, 그것까지 포함해서 선배님들에게는 해 드려야 할 말이 많습니다. 일단 따라오시죠."
이신우는 한 점의 망설임 없이 자신을 따르는 스물일곱의 용사 언데드, 그리고 여전히 현실감 없이 휘청대는 로이드와 에리안을 데리고 아지트로 복귀했다.
이렇게 해서 그는 지금 지하에 살아 있는, 죽어 있는 모든 용사들의 대통합을 이루는 데에 성공한 것이었다. 이젠 객관적으로 봐도 그들 쪽의 전력이 황군을 뛰어넘는 것 같았다. ……어쩌면 상당한 차이를 두고.
"하, 그럼 정말로 우리만 모르고 있었던 건가. 끙끙댔던 것이 바보처럼 느껴져."
"일부러 말을 하지 않은 게 아니라, 활동 범위가 겹친 사람들에게만 얘기를 했던 거죠. ……세이라 같은 경우도 있었고."
"무슨 얘기를 하고 싶은 건지 압니다. 그런 눈으로 나를 보지 말아 주겠습니까? 과거에 저질렀던 일로 언제까지 나를 놀릴 생각이죠, 당신은?"
프린스 때보다는 아무래도 조금 시간이 걸렸다. 그러나 크라티아에 이어 반시로 재탄생한 세이라까지 만나게 되자 로이드와 에리안도 그저 고개를 끄덕이는 수밖에는 없게 되었다.
인간이란 생각보다 단순해서 나 말고 다른 사람들이 모두 정상으로 받아들이는 일에 대해서는 약간의 거부감이 있더라도 순순히 받아들이고 마는 경향이 있는 것이다.
"프린스까지…… 그 녀석이 너를 인정했다면, 나는 더 할 말이 없다."
"그러니까 대체 로이드 선배랑 프린스는 어떤 관계예요?"
"일단 로이드와 프린스가 둘 사이의 관계를 서로 다르게 해석하고 있는 것만은 분명해요."
"뭐?!"
프린스와 개인 채팅까지 마친 로이드는 순순히 현실을 받아들이기로 했다. 이신우가 좋은 놈이든 나쁜 놈이든 그 덕분에 목숨을 건진 것만은 분명한 사실이기도 했고, 언데드라고 해서 무조건 처단해야 할 대상이 아니라는 것도 이젠 어느 정도 납득하고 있기도 했다.
"그럼 앞으로는 채팅 채널을 이용하면 안 된다고? 하지만 그 침입자 본인은 죽은 것이 아닌가?"
그렇게 되니 남는 것은 현 상황 인식. 이신우는 시갈드를 사냥하는 과정에서 지하의 태양이 떨어진 것부터 시작하여(그들은 그저 밤이 길어져 태양이 뜨지 않는다는 정도로만 인식하고 있었다.) 여태까지 일어난 일들, 죽어 나간 12장군들, 앞으로 그들이 맞이해야 할 전투 등에 대해 간결하고도 정확하게 전달했다.
"이번에 증명된 것은 가능성입니다. 신의 능력으로 수호받고 있던 영역에 외부인이 침입해 올지도 모른다는 가능성. 물론 용사들은 이제 모두 우리 수중에 있고, 리치도 죽었지만…… 혹여 어디선가 누군가가 다른 수단을 통해 채팅 채널에 접근해 올지도 모르는 거죠."
그러니까 황제를 사냥하고 지하를 깔끔하게 정리하는 그 순간까지는 채팅 채널을 사용해서는 안 된다고, 이신우는 용사들에게 신신당부했다. 심지어 비밀상점 이용권을 이용하는 것까지 불가능해진 상태였기에 그들을 어이없게 만들었다.
"아, 이건 지독하네. 어둠의 원천과 바로 연결되어 있는 저주예요. 이걸 해결하기 전까지는 힘들겠네요."
"……이제부터 신약도 사지 못하고, 상점의 보급을 받을 수도 없다는 얘긴가."
"그렇다고 봐야죠. 뭐 상관없어요. 이제 바로 최종전이니까."
사실 이신우는 얼마든지 대마도사의 저주를 뚫고 비밀상점에 들어갈 수 있지만 굳이 그런 말은 하지 않기로 했다.
그들을 비밀상점에 데려가려면 계약을 해야 하는데 굳이 그러기까진 귀찮았을뿐더러 사실 최후의 결전이 코앞으로 다가온 지금 시점에 뭔가를 더 한다고 극적으로 바뀔 것까지도 없었기 때문이다. 까놓고 말해 그들에게 별로 중요한 역할을 맡길 생각도 없었다.
"그래도 식량 쟁여 놓은 건 많으니까 걱정 마시고요."
"지상까지 나갈 수 있다는 건 정말 놀라운 소식인데…… 우리도 지상에 나가 프린스와 합류하면 어떨까."
"그것도 좋은 생각이긴 한데, 지상에 한 번에 많은 강자가 등장하는 것도 좀 그래서요."
구라였다. 지금 지상에 이 시대착오적 용사와 엘프를 내보냈다간 분명히 썩 좋지 않은 일이 발생할 것이라는 확신이 있었기에 그것만은 반드시 막아야 했다. 로이드는 다행히 그의 설득에 금방 넘어가 주었다.
"그런가, 하긴 나도 지하의 저주를 정화하는 순간에는 함께하고 싶으니까…… 그 모든 것이 끝난 후에 다 함께 나가도록 하자."
"물론입니다. 정말로 얼마 남지 않았어요. ……정말로."
"우우, 지상, 지상…… 전 지상의 자연이 무척이나 보고 싶은데요. 어쩌면 그곳에는 정령들이 많을지도 모르고."
"아, 그러고 보면."
엘프인 에리안은 이신우 이상으로 정령, 자연이라는 단어와 연이 깊은 존재였다. 이신우는 잠시 망설이다가 그녀에게 제안했다.
"선배님, 혹시 저랑 동업하실 생각 없으세요?"
"동업? 갑자기 그게 무슨 말이죠?"
"선배님도 지하 정화하고 나면 지상에 정착해야 할 것 아닙니까. 언제까지 위험하게 몬스터들이랑만 싸우실 거 아니잖아요? 거기서 제가! 선배님께 딱 맞는 평생직장으로 삼을 만한 일을 소개해 드릴 수 있습니다. 그러니까 일단은…… 따라와 보시면 알아요."
"대체 그게 무슨……."
따라간 결과, 그들은 와인 공장과 연결되어 있는 포도밭에 도착할 수 있었다. 하늘문의 열쇠를 사용하면 금방이었다. 분위기는 너무나 달랐지만…… 에리안은 곧 눈치챘다. 깨닫지 않을 수 없었다.
"아니, 이곳은…… 제가 당신에게 맡겼던 포도밭이잖아요!"
[제로폴, 어서 와…… 어, 엘프다!]
[살아 있는 엘프는 정말 오랜만에 보는데! 반가워!]
그때 이신우를 발견하고 우르르 날아오던 드라이어드들이 에리안을 발견하고는 꺅꺅 떠들기 시작했다. 반면 에리안은 드라이어드들의 모습을 보고는 어안이 벙벙해졌다.
"아니 이럴 수가, 지하에 살아남은 정령들이 있었다니……."
"혹시 죽음의 숲 기억하세요? 그곳 지하에는 살아남은 드라이어드들이 저주에 저항하며 버티고 있었어요. 그들을 이곳으로 데려와 풀어놓은 겁니다. 그 덕에 선배님이 가꾸었던 포도들이 더욱 싱싱하게 자라날 수 있었고요."
"죽음의 숲, 이라니……."
"그때 채팅 채널에서 그와 관련된 대화를 나눈 적이 있었지. 그렇다면 넌 그때 이미 죽음의 숲을 통과할 만한 능력이 있었다는 건가……."
"뭐…… 그렇죠."
로이드는 이신우의 말에 그저 허탈하게 웃고 말았다. 이건 뭐 열등감을 태우고 할 여지조차 없었다. 그는 자신과는 완전히 다른 영역에 있었던 것이다.
자신과 이신우의 격차를 깨달은 그 순간 로이드의 마음속에서 무언가가 뚝, 꺾였다. 하지만 그에겐 오히려 그것이 후련하게 느껴질 정도였다. 죽음의 저주를 비롯해 그를 필요 이상으로 조급하게 만들었던 충동이 사라진 것이다.
'애초에 내 생각이 어리석었어. 내가 누군가보다 더 용사다울 필요는 없었는데…….'
그러나 이때 좌절감이나 무력감을 느끼지 않는다는 것이 과연 로이드의 멘탈이 비범함을 증명했다. 타인과 자신을 비교하는 것을 그만두고 나니 객관적으로 자기 자신을 보고, 다시 자신의 페이스대로 노력할 수 있게 되었다.
이신우가 이때 로이드의 생각을 알았더라면 과연 동화책에나 나올 법한 용사님이라며 몸서리를 쳤으리라.
"아니, 정말로 제가 돌보던 시절의 기운이 남아 있잖아요?! 이건 남아 있는 수준이 아니라 진화했다고 볼 수 있는데요!"
[엘프야, 이쪽으로 와 줘! 포도가 싱싱하지 않은 곳이 있어!]
[엘프의 기운을 뿌려 줘! 과일은 역시 엘프가 돌보는 게 제일 좋아!]
"앗, 아앗…… 아, 알겠어요. 같이 가요!"
한편 에리안은 금세 드라이어드들에게 이끌려 포도밭 안으로 사라졌다. 이신우도 드라이어드들과 함께 비교적 포도밭을 훌륭하게 가꾸었지만, 숲과 밭의 달인 엘프가 직접 나서면 포도의 질을 훨씬 더 높일 수 있으리라!
그리고 그것으로 인해 커센트리 엘레멘탈의 브랜드 가치는 더더욱 상승할 것이다. 대륙에 한 명밖에 없는 엘프가 직접 돌보는 포도밭이라니 홍보 가치는 실로 무한하다!
"그러니까 선배님도 힘내 주시죠. 하프 엘프들도 엘프의 권능은 기본적으로 타고난다고 하니까."
"가, 갑자기 무슨 소리야! ……그, 그렇게 티가 나는 건가?"
"당연히 티가 나죠."
원래 남자는 본인 일은 둔감해도 다른 커플의 분위기는 민감하게 감지하는 능력이 있는 것이다! 이신우 역시 이전 그들을 만났을 때와는 질적으로 다른 둘 사이의 분위기를 느끼고 있었다. 최소 한 걸음 이상은 더 나아간 상태. 그나저나 이렇게 되면…….
"그런데 로이드 선배님, 한 명의 남성이 여러 명의 여성과 결혼을 하는 것에 대해선 어떻게 생각하세요?"
"사랑하는 한 명을 끝까지 책임지는 것, 그것이 한 명의 사람으로서, 남자로서 내가 할 수 있는 최선이라고 생각해. ……크흠, 그 뭐냐, 지금은 그게 에리안이 되겠지."
"왜 이런 부분만 이상하게 용사답지 않은…… 아니, 이게 아니라."
이래서야 마치 자신을 욕하고 있는 것 같지 않은가. 이신우는 급히 방향을 선회했다.
"프린스 선배는 어떻게 생각하세요?"
"프린스? 좋은 친구지. 그때도 말한 적이 있지? 그 녀석이 없었다면 나는 버티기 힘들었을 거야."
"그렇군요."
이신우는 잠시 머뭇거리는 듯하다가, 드라이어드들과 함께 포도밭을 돌아다니는 에리안을 일별하곤 로이드의 귀에 대고 조심스러운 말투로 말했다.
"사실 프린스 선배님이 제게 간곡히 부탁했습니다. 무슨 일이든 할 테니 로이드를 꼭 구해 달라고."
"프린스가 그렇게까지 날 소중히 여기고 있었단 말이야……?"
"네. 그리고 프린스 선배님은 여성이죠. 로이드 선배님과 오랜 시간을 같이한 여성."
"그야 저번에 본인이 말했으니 나도 알고 있지…… 응?"
제아무리 둔감한 로이드라도 이렇게까지 말하는데 이신우가 하고 싶은 말이 뭔지 모를 리가 없었다. 그의 이마에 식은땀이 흘렀다.
"아니, 설마 그럴 리가…… 농담하지 마, 신우."

"Lee Shin Woo, you're..."

"What!?"

"Y-You're the Heaven Defying General...?"
"Yes."
Lee Shin Woo quickly affirmed, and Lloyd gaped. Lee Shin Woo grinned and briefly switched his face to that of an undead, and then switched back. Lloyd's mouth had widened so much that it seemed like his jaw and the roof of his mouth would separate.
"As I thought... If that's the case, then everything makes sense. If I hadn't seen your undead transformation just now, then I wouldn't have been sure. Did you always have the ability to transform into an undead? If not, then..."
"It's the opposite. I'm an undead, but I can transform into a human. Well, my human form is perfect, so there's not much difference either way."
"How? No, why...? Why did you...?"
While Erian seemed to get the gist of things, Lloyd was still confused. Lloyd's expression reminded him of Prince, causing him to grin. He then turned around and said.
"Now then, there's a lot I have to tell you. Please follow me."
Without an ounce of hesitation, Lee Shin Woo led the 27 undead heroes, as well as Lloyd, who couldn't accept reality and was tottering around, and Erian to his base.
And thus, Lee Shin Woo had unified the remaining heroes underground, undead or otherwise. Objectively speaking, their forces surpassed the Imperial Army's. ...Perhaps the disparity between their forces was wider than he thought.
"Ha, so we were the only ones out of the loop. I feel stupid for suffering."
"I didn't keep it secret on purpose. Rather, I only told those who were in the same area as me. ...There was the case with Seira too."
"I know what you're trying to say. Could you not look at me like that? How long are you going to use that (past events) against me?"
It inevitably took longer to convince them than Prince. But upon meeting Kratia, as well as Seira, the Banshee, they had no choice but to nod their heads.
Humans were quite simple; even if an individual didn't agree with something, if the majority agreed, then the individual tended to accept the majority's viewpoint.
"Even Prince... If she acknowledged you, then I should too."
"So what's your relationship with Prince anyway, Senior Lloyd?"
"All I know is that the two of them think of their relationship differently."
"What!?"
Lloyd, who'd even gone so far as to send a private message to Prince, was forced to accept the cold, hard truth. Regardless of whether Lee Shin Woo was a good guy or an evil bastard, it was because of him that they had survived. Plus, he now realized that he didn't need to strike him down just because he was an undead.
"So we can't use the chatting channel anymore? But didn't you already kill the Archmage?"
All that was left was explaining the current situation to them. First, he explained that, as a result of killing Seagald, the underground's sun was no more (they just assumed that the night had gotten longer and that the sun wasn't rising). He then explained what he'd done thus far, which of the 12 Generals he'd killed, and explained the details of the final battle concisely.
"We've been shown there's a chance. A chance that an outsider can enter a domain protected by God herself. Of course, all of the heroes are on our side now and the Lich is dead, but... Someone else might try a different approach to tamper with the chatting channel."
So, he requested that they not use the chatting channel, at least until the Emperor was dead and the Underground Empire was completely purified. What's worse, they could no longer use their permits to access the secret shop, so they were speechless.
"Man, this sucks. The curse is directly connected to the source of darkness. It'll be difficult for us until we can figure something out."
"...We can't buy the medicine anymore, and what's worse, we can't buy supplies from the secret shop either."

To be honest, Lee Shin Woo could always break through the Archmage's curse and enter the secret shop, but he decided not to tell them that.
If he wanted to bring them to the secret shop, he would have to form a contract with them. Not only was that a pain in the ass, but the final battle was right before them, so bringing them to the secret shop at this point wouldn't do much, if anything. To put it bluntly, he didn't plan on giving them any important assignments.
"I've saved up a lot of supplies, so you won't have to worry about that."
"It's really surprising that you can travel to the surface... How about we go to the surface and group up with Prince?"
"It's a good idea, but it's a bit iffy to bring so many strong people to the surface all at once."
He was lying. Lee Shin Woo was 100% sure that if he sent this anachronic human and Elf to the surface then something bad would happen. Thus, he had to do whatever was necessary to stop them from going. Fortunately, Lloyd was persuaded immediately.
"Is that so? I'd like to purify the undead curse together, but... I guess we could all just go up there after the battle's over."
"Of course. We're really close. ...Really."
"Ooh, the surface... I'd really like to see its natural environment. There might be a lot of spirits up there."
"Ah, now that you mention it..."
The Elf, Erian, was more attuned to the spirits and nature than Lee Shin Woo was. Lee Shin Woo hesitated briefly, but ultimately suggested.
"Senior, would you like to be my partner?"
"Partner? What are you talking about all of a sudden?"
"Once you've purified the Empire, you'll have to settle on the surface. You're not planning to live dangerously fighting monsters forever, are you? That's where I come in! I can offer you a lifelong job. So, for now... well, you'll see what I mean if you follow me."
"What exactly are you talking about..."
She followed him, arriving at the grape vineyard directly connected to their wine factory. He could get there in a flash with the Heaven Door's Key. The atmosphere was completely different, but... Erian quickly noticed. There was no way she wouldn't.
"No, wait. This is... This is the vineyard I entrusted to you!"
[Welcome, Paul Zero... Oh, it's the Elf!]
[It's been a long time since I last saw a living, breathing Elf! Nice to meet you!]
Having noticed him, the Dryads flew towards him, but once they noticed Erian as well, they began to chatter. Whereas, Erian was dumbfounded at the sight of the Dryads.
"How is this possible? To think there were still spirits within the Empire..."
"Do you remember the Forest of Death? There were some Dryads resisting the curse there. I brought them here and cured them of the curse. Because of them, the grapes you raised grew even livelier than before."
"The Forest of Death..."
"At the time, I remember us talking about it in the chatting channel. If that's the case, then that means you were already strong enough to get through the Forest of Death back then..."
"Well... yes."
Lloyd smiled hollowly. He couldn't even feel his inferiority complex flare. Lee Shin Woo was in a completely different league.
When he realized how outclassed he was, something with him snapped. But he actually felt relieved. He'd had an urge to become stronger, and the undead curse had only intensified that urge, making him impatient. However, that impulse had disappeared right then and there.
'I was a fool. There's no need for me to be more 'hero-like' than someone else...'
Him not feeling frustrated or powerless was just an example of Lloyd's incredible mental fortitude. Once he'd stopped comparing himself to Lee Shin Woo and looked at himself objectively, he became able to do things at his own pace again.
If Lee Shin Woo had known what Lloyd was thinking, then he'd say something like 'he's like a hero straight out of a fairy tale.'
"Wait, the energy from when I raised the grapes is still here!? No, it's not just here, but it's evolved!"
[Hey, Elf. Come over here! There's a place where the grapes aren't growing that well!]
[Spread your elvish energy! It's best if elves look after fruit!]
"I... I understand. Let's go together!"
Erian followed the Dryads and disappeared amidst the field of grape trees. With the Dryad's help, Lee Shin Woo had grown the grapes quite well, but he couldn't match up to an Elf; Elves were masters of the forest and fields, so if they were to intervene, then the quality of the grapes would skyrocket!
As a result, the value of the Kerr Century Elemental Brandy would rise as well. To think that the sole elf on the continent was looking over the grape trees; she was invaluable!
"So please do your best, Senior. They say that a half-elf is born with an elf's authority."
"W-What's with you all of a sudden!? ...I-Is it that obvious?"
"It is that obvious."
Even the most dim-witted of men possessed the ability to spot couples!
Compared to when he'd met them last, he felt something qualitatively different between the two of them. They'd taken at least another step forward. At any rate, if this happens, then...
"By the way, what do you think of one man marrying several women, Senior Lloyd?"
"You have to love one person to the very end. I believe that that's the best I can do as a person and as a man. ...Ahem, I suppose that's Erian right now."
"Why are you not like a hero in this aspect... Err, never mind."
It sounded like Lloyd was criticizing him, or at least, it came off that way. Lee Shin Woo decided to change the subject.
"What do you think of Senior Prince?"
"Prince? She's a good friend. I told you before, didn't I? It would've been hard for me to endure without her."
"I see."
Lee Shin Woo hesitated briefly, but then he glanced at Erian, who was going around the grape trees, and carefully whispered into Lloyd's ear.
"To be honest, Prince begged me to save you; she was even willing to do anything to ensure your safety."
"Prince really cherishes me that much...?"
"Yes. And Prince is a girl. A girl who's been with you for a very long time."
"She already told me, so I know that... Huh?"
Even the slow-witted Lloyd couldn't misunderstand when Lee Shin Woo was spelling it out for him. Cold sweat flowed down his forehead.
"No, wait. There's no way... Don't joke around, Shin Woo."
"So you get it. Please think about it by yourself. You'll find an answer."
"Hey, wait. Why are you telling me this now!?"
'Why now? I can't be the only one with girl troubles,' Lee Shin Woo thought. However, Lee Shin Woo didn't say anything aloud and merely gave him a thumbs up. Behind him, Lloyd was suffering from the truth that'd been laid bare. Serves him right.

그 경우 특정한 마을이나 도시의 수호신이 되는 등 이점을 제공할 수도 있었다.

이러한 소영역의 특징은 자연과 문명 발달 과정에서 자연스럽게 발견되는 기술과 지식을 포괄한다는 점이었다.
덕분에 이런 영역은 시간이 지나면 플레이어들이 공통적으로 들게 되는 영역이 즐비했다.
'이 시점에서 가축의 소영역이나 곡식의 소영역 같은 걸 가지지 않은 플레이어는 없겠지. 물론 스타팅에 따라 레벨 차이는 좀 있겠지만.'
그리고 종족 영역 또한 이러한 공통적으로 가지게 되는 편이었다.
첫 번째, 그리고 두 번째 종족 이후로 플레이어는 계속해서 여러 종족을 얻을 수 있었다.
'인간이나 엘프는 인기 종족이니 인간의 영역이나 엘프의 영역은 이제 하나 정돈 가지고 있는 플레이어가 많겠지.'
아직은 얻을 수 없는 대영역을 제외하면, 고유 영역이라고 부르는 범주가 있었다.
이런 고유 영역은 게임 플레이에서 아주 랜덤하게 발생하고 그 숫자도 다양했다.
무엇보다도 다른 플레이어와 공통으로 얻는 게 불가능했다.
한 게임에 무조건 하나.
'어느 정도 고유 영역을 얻는데 조건이 필요하다고 알려졌지만, 얻고 싶다고 얻을 수 있는 건 아니었지.'
공통되는 소영역과 종족 영역에 따른 레벨 차이에 더해, 어떤 고유 영역을 가지고 있는 지야말로 플레이어의 정체성을 결정하는 셈이었다.
때문에 성운은 악신을 죽이고 고유 영역을 얻은 것에 기뻐했다.
특히나 '시체의 영역'은 성운이 처음 보는 고유 영역이었다.
아마 뱀파이어나 늑대인간, 그리고 딥원처럼 이번 플레이에서 처음 등장한 영역일 가능성이 높았다.
'하지만 쓰레기였지.'
잘 생각해 보면 그럴 수밖에 없었다.
시체는 시체일 뿐이다.
시체는 움직일 수 없고, 만들어진 이상 썩기 바쁘다.
실제로 절우비는 플레이 도중 영역의 힘을 사용하는 일이 없었는데, 그 수수께끼가 풀린 셈이기도 했다.
성운은 시체의 영역을 통해서 가능한 것이 있는지 살펴보았지만 적어도 당장은 쓸모가 없다는 결론을 내렸다.

성운은 흥미를 가지고 야분과 시서펜트를 내려다보았다.
'그리고 그 고유 영역이 흉신을 조종할 수 있는 힘이라면?'

The Deep One's head exploded when hit by Hwae-Sa's arm, which was thicker than it.
The giant flying fish separated from its owner and glided above the railing before diving into the sea, and the knight was thrown and left on the deck.
Hwae-Sa stepped on the Deep One's head and crushed it.
"I destroy everything!"
At those words, more giant flying fish knights flew over The Humiliation of Pirates. But this time, Hwae-Sa didn't get a chance to attack.
"They're coming."
Vasen Lak Orazen was also holding a spear. Even when a giant flying fish charged toward him with its mouth open, he remained steadfast.
'That's only meant to scare me. While the teeth of the fish is a threat, the real danger comes from the trident that follows.'
Vasen did not move, and the giant flying fish was directly pierced by Vasen's spear at a 45 degree angle.
Crack!
The moment the wooden spear broke under the giant flying fish's weight, Vasen took a step back and saw the fish fall onto the deck. Then the Deep One knight on top also fell. The knight had a surprised look on their face.
"Hmph."
With a snort, Vasen unsheathed his sword and charged at the knight. It didn't even take more than one slash for him to cut off the Deep One's head.
Vasen then shouted to the soldiers, "Don't be greedy! There's no need to move! If they avoid you, let them rush into the next spearhead!"
Just as Vasen commanded, the soldiers remained still and blocked the attacks of the knights riding on giant flying fish.
General Ian Tata repeated Vasen's command and thought to himself, 'Of course. When you think about it, even what seems like a new form of attack is nothing but a variation of an existing tactic. They're riding on something stronger than them and using that strength to attack, so they're actually no different than regular cavalry.'
Ian thought that they could actually be easier to face than cavalry on land. Using spears was a basic counter for cavalry, but Cockatoos often avoided spearheads as they were thin and had thick feathers, and the intense pressure from horses shaking the earth often caused infantry squares to break formation.
'But when these knights are gliding low enough in the air, we can pierce and kill the giant flying fish before their tridents reach us. And unlike cavalry on land, the Deep Ones thrown off aren't protected by other cavalry, but fall into our square helplessly instead.'
As Black Scale's military ships effectively fought back against the giant flying fish knights, the other military ships belatedly followed suit.
Vasen looked around the battlefield.
'But among the ships that were attacked first, the ones that suffered severe damage are busy fighting against the pirates who have climbed onto their ships. And there's no way the pirates will stop fighting now.'
It was just as Vasen expected. Pirate ships began to appear from Doltan Island.
"It's pirates! About 120 ships!"
If the situation hadn't derailed to this point, Vasen would've thought it would be worth fighting the pirates even though their number was great and it could lead to a battle on board. But right now, the military ships in the front were already struggling with the giant flying fish knights and the Deep Ones from the sea.
'There are also ships that can't move. If we leave them be, there's a danger that the other ships will get tangled up with them.'
If that happened, pirates would attack from between the ships, and it would be difficult for Black Scale, which had suffered relatively less damage, to target the pirates; the current cannons weren't the most accurate weapon.
'There's no other choice.'
At the watchkeeper's shout, Vasen said to Theone Itimo, "Captain, we should go forward."
"I thought you would say that," replied Theone.
"We need to go around the military ships of the allied navies and take the lead."
"Only us?"
"It took a little time, but we succeeded in chasing away the giant flying fish knights, and while there is a fight on board their ships, individual Deep One pirates aren't that threatening. Over time, the allied navies will recover their combat capabilities."
"...So you're saying that it'll just be us until then."
Vasen shrugged.
"What else can I say?"
Black Scale's military ships began their advance.
As expected, Vasen saw the allied navies putting their ships against each other to fight the Deep Ones on board and chase them away.
'It might take a little longer than I expected.'
When The Humiliation of Pirates was passing one of the navy ships, Whalebone, a big shadow jumped down from on top of Whalebone's mast. The Garuda had his wings spread wide and landed softly, which seemed at odds with his size. It was Mazdari.
Noting that the soldiers had gotten nervous, Vasen raised his hand to hold them back.
"What is it, Garuda?"
Mazdari didn't answer the question right away and instead said something irrelevant.
"That's unexpected."
"What do you mean?"
Mazdari smirked.
"Those one hundred and more pirate ships will clash with the allied navies first. It would be easier for Black Scale to destroy the pirate ships if you fired at them in the meantime."
"Are you suggesting that we attack our allies?"
"Allies? Is that what you really think? Black Scale and the other countries should be enemies, no?"
Vasen couldn't really deny that.
Mazadari continued to say, "And above all, you would be able to destroy the pirate ships as well as? the allied navies doing that. You even have the perfect justification."
Vasen grinned and replied, "It sounds like you were hoping for me to do that."
"Were you afraid of my power?"
"No, I would have made the same choice even if you had no power. While we are enemies, a fight is breaking out. I'm not dealing with the next fight when we haven't even won the current one, Garuda."
"Hm."
"Also, there's no guarantee that the 120 pirate ships over there are all there is to them. It's common sense to conserve your troops—if the troops aren't considered expendable, that is."
Mazdari seemed rather dissatisfied, but it also seemed like he couldn't come up with a counter argument.
Vasen then continued to say, "Anyway, you should get on the other ship if you wanna go back. You're quite an important figure, so I'll give you the chance to return."
"No, there's no need for that. Because you'll need me."
"We'll need you? Why is that?"
The Garuda pointed at the pirate ship at the very front.
"Because a dangerous man is coming."
Vasen turned to where Mazdari was pointing at. That something was now visible to Vasen as well.
"That's…"
Leading the pirate fleet was the biggest pirate ship. A ship that big would usually be slower, but the particular ship was actually way faster than the other ones.
Yaboon, who was standing at the front of the ship, yelled, "Charge! Destroy their ships!"
It wasn't another pirate that Yaboon was yelling at. He was yelling at a large Sea Serpent tied to the front of the ship and pulling it. There was a saying that while Drakes were the most superior on land, Sea Serpents were the equivalent in water due to their sheer size. The Sea Serpent was about forty meters long, and its head was big enough for it to swallow a few people at once. With no limbs, it looked like a giant water snake, but in addition to its enormous size, the spikes along its spine and the rough scales covering its body made it clear that it was an existence on a different level. And the Sea Serpent chained to the pirate ship didn't even seem like an ordinary one.
-Once I kill them… I'll kill you too!
At the Sea Serpent's threat, Yaboon growled with his teeth showing.
"Try it if you will! Do you think something like you can go against Deep Light?"
The Sea Serpent rolled its eyes back and glared at Yaboon, but that was all it did.
Meanwhile, a number of gods were standing above the sea where the battle was taking place. However, they were now keeping their distance from each other so that they wouldn't be able to hear each other talk, and Eldar was the only one next to Sung-Woon.
Sung-Woon looked at the Sea Serpent.
[Ancient Shining Tail Sea Serpent]
Sung-Woon then mumbled, "It's a Fiend."
"A Fiend?" Eldar mumbled back. "So did the Deep Ones tame…a Fiend?"
Sung-Woon was also surprised.
"I guess so. How did they do that?"
Abominations and Fiends were generally enemies to defeat. Particularly intelligent individuals were able to talk, and if civilization had progressed to a greater level, a Fiend could decide to play things safe, and there would thus be the possibility for negotiation. In that case, a Fiend could end up becoming the guardian of a particular village or a city, thus benefiting a player.
'But after listening to the conversation just now, it doesn't seem to be a voluntary deal.'
Sung-Woon thought to himself.
'Does it perhaps have to do with Domains?'
As he thought so, he checked the Domain he had obtained after killing another evil god, Jeol Woo-Bi.
[Domain: Corpse]
It wasn't a Small Area, but a Domain.
'It's not a Species Domain or a Large Domain, but Domain. So that means it must be a Unique Domain…'
There were 32 Major Small Areas that players could obtain at the beginning, and 32 Minor Small Areas that players could obtain through things like Fiends or ancient ruins, so altogether there were 64 Small Areas. The characteristic of these Small Areas was that they included technology or knowledge that could naturally be discovered in the process of developing nature and civilization. As a result, there were a set of Small Areas players would often acquire over time.
'There wouldn't be a player who doesn't have Small Area: Livestock or Small Area: Crops by now. Of course, there would be differences in levels depending on when each player acquired the particular Small Area.'
And Species Domains were also commonly shared among players. After obtaining the first and second species, a player could continue to obtain other species.
'Humans and Elves are popular species, so there's probably a lot of players with Domain: Humans, and Domain: Elves.'
Excluding the Large Domains that weren't possible to obtain yet, there was a category called Unique Domains. These Unique Domains were generated randomly throughout the game, and even the numbers of them varied. Most importantly, it wasn't possible for multiple players to obtain the same Unique Domain. Only one per game.
'It's known that there are certain conditions to be fulfilled before one can obtain a Unique Domain, but it's not something you can get just because you want to.'
In addition to the levels of the Small Areas and Species Domains a player possessed, their Unique Domain was what determined their identity. Therefore, Sung-Woon was happy when he obtained a Unique Domain after killing the evil god. In particular, Domain: Corpse was a Unique Domain that he had never seen before. There was a high chance that it was something newly introduced to this game, just like the Vampires, Werewolves, and Deep Ones.
'But it was trash.'
On second thought, it only made sense for the particular Unique Domain to be useless. Corpses were corpses. Dead bodies weren't able to move, and they would only rot.
In fact, Jeol Woo-Bi never had the chance to use the power of the Domain, and the mystery was only solved now. Sung-Woon had checked what Domain: Corpse would be capable of, but judged that there wasn't anything immediately useful to him. That had been one hundred years ago.
'All living things die, so the level of the Domain continues to rise. Even so, it's still useless.'
However, things could be different now.
'Jeol Woo-Bi had a Unique Domain. Then there's a high chance that Sha-Cha also has a Unique Domain.'
Sung-Woon looked down at Yaboon and the Sea Serpent with interest.
'And what if that Unique Domain has the power to control Fiends?'

"P-please, at least give me back my lab equipment!" a young woman shouted.
"Are you freaking kidding me?!" an angry man shouted back. "My boys and I already gave you more than a couple of warnings! Look where it got us!"
"It's been half a year since you failed to pay the money on time. It's about time you made it up to us."
I followed the voices. When I reached the intersection of the maze of alleys, I found an old shop in a relatively open space. The people were fighting in front of it.
"I-if you also take my equipment... I really have no way of putting food on my table..."
"Ignore her. We don't need to hear her excuses. Take them all!"
Bulky gangsters loaded machines onto their handcart. A woman in her late twenties, who seemed to own the old shop, clung onto the handcart.
"A week!" she pleaded. "Give me one more week, please. Actually, if you can just give me five more days—"
"That one week became a month, and then half a year!"

"I-I haven't finished making that potion...!"
" Sigh. How did I get involved with a crazy Chemist like you? Lady! Listen to me! Never get involved with the potion-making business again! I mean it!"
The gangsters pushed away the hand cart deep into the alley, leaving behind the shop owner, the nearby residents, and me. Lost in despair, the shop owner absentmindedly sat on her knees, staring at the ground. On the other hand, the spectators were busily whispering among themselves.

"She's young, so she thought business is easy..."

"Let's go. I can't believe it. It's not like she's actually achieved anything..."

"It's really good... I'm not lying..."
In the end, the shop owner flopped down onto the ground.

"Are you open for business?" I asked.
Yes, she wasn't a beggar. An ordinary Chemist was certainly not the right description for her either.
"If you are, I would like to order some potions."
She was the Master Alchemist, a Chemist who was going to become the Rank 5 Hunter. Although she was currently outside the rankings, she would without a doubt make it someday.
"They're a little complicated to make—can you do it?" I asked.
"Ah, yes, yes! Of course! I can make you anything! " The Chemist's face brightened up.
Complicated potions meant expensive potions. Her shop was on the brink of going out of business, so she must feel like someone had pulled her back from the edge of a cliff.
"But how complicated are the potions you're looking for...?"
In the future, I would never be able to order from this Chemist, no matter how rich I was, but it was different right now.

The Chemist's jaw dropped to the ground. Who cared if she looked a little like a beggar? In my eyes, the Chemist looked like a goose who was going to lay me eggs of pure gold!

I was going to become her first regular customer.
